text:
Dwayne Douglas Johnson, also known as The Rock, is an American actor, businessman, and former professional wrestler. Born on May 2, 1972, in Hayward, California, Johnson is the son of professional wrestler Rocky Johnson and Ata Johnson, a star of the Polynesian professional wrestling promotion, the World Wrestling Council.

Johnson's early life was marked by a love for football. He was a standout player at Freedom High School in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, and received a full scholarship to play football at the University of Miami. He won a national championship with the Hurricanes in 1991 and was cut from the Canadian Football League's Calgary Stampeders in 1995.

Johnson then turned to professional wrestling, following in his father's footsteps. He was signed by the World Wrestling Federation (WWF), now known as WWE, in 1996 and quickly became known for his charismatic personality, athleticism, and signature moves. He won six world championships during his wrestling career, including the WWF/E Championship on six occasions.

In 2001, Johnson retired from professional wrestling to pursue an acting career. He made his film debut in "The Mummy Returns" and went on to appear in a string of successful movies, including "The Scorpion King," "Walking Tall," "Be Cool," and "The Game Plan." He received critical acclaim for his roles in "Get Smart," "The Other Guys," and "Pain & Gain."

Johnson's breakout role came in 2013 with the blockbuster hit "Fast & Furious 6," which grossed over $788 million worldwide. He reprised his role as Luke Hobbs in "Fast & Furious 7" and "Furious 8." He has also starred in the highly successful "Jumanji" franchise, including "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" and "Jumanji: The Next Level."

In addition to his acting career, Johnson is a successful businessman. He co-founded Seven Bucks Productions, a film and television production company, and has produced several projects, including the HBO drama "Ballers," in which he also starred.

Johnson has been named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world and has been awarded the People's Choice Award for Favorite Action Movie Star. He is married to producer Lauren Hashian and has three daughters, including Simone Alexandra Johnson, who followed in his footsteps by becoming a professional wrestler.

Dwayne Douglas Johnson was born on May 2, 1972, in Hayward, California. He is the son of Rocky Johnson, a professional wrestler, and Ata Johnson, a Samoan wrestler and manager. Dwayne's maternal grandfather, "High Chief" Peter Maivia, was also a wrestler and a promoter for the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA).

Growing up, Dwayne was a football player and was even offered a scholarship to play for the University of Miami. However, he ultimately chose to follow in his father's footsteps and pursue a career in professional wrestling.

Johnson began his wrestling career in the World Wrestling Federation (WWF), now known as WWE, in 1996. He quickly became a fan favorite, known for his charisma, athleticism, and signature moves like the "People's Elbow" and "Rock Bottom." During his wrestling career, Johnson won multiple championships, including the WWF Championship six times.

After retiring from wrestling in 2004, Johnson transitioned to acting, making his film debut in 2001 with a small role in "The Mummy Returns." He then landed a starring role in "The Scorpion King," a prequel to "The Mummy Returns." The film's success led to Johnson being cast as the titular character in "The Fast and the Furious" franchise.

Since then, Johnson has become one of the most successful and highest-paid actors in Hollywood, starring in blockbuster films like "Jumanji," "Moana," "Rampage," and "Skyscraper." He has also produced several projects, including TV shows like "Titan Games" and films like "Jumanji: The Next Level."

Johnson is married to Lauren Hashian and has three daughters, Jasmine, Tiana, and Havyn. He is also stepfather to his wife's two children, Simone and Matteo.

Throughout his career, Johnson has received numerous awards and accolades, including a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, a People's Choice Award, and multiple Teen Choice Awards. He is also a devoted philanthropist, supporting organizations like the Make-A-Wish Foundation and the Boys & Girls Clubs of America.

And that's a quick look at the incredible life and career of Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson!

Dwayne Douglas Johnson was born on May 2, 1972, in Hayward, California, to Ata Johnson and Rocky Johnson, a professional wrestler. He is of Samoan descent through his maternal grandmother, Lia Maivia, and a Canadian by birth.

Johnson then turned to professional wrestling, following in the footsteps of his father and grandfather, who were also wrestlers. Johnson became one of the most successful professional wrestlers of all time, holding multiple championships, including the WWF Championship seven times.

He went on to star in films like The Rundown (2003), Walking Tall (2004), and The Game Plan (2007). His breakthrough role came with Fast & Furious franchise, playing Luke Hobbs in Fast Five (2011) and subsequent installments.

Since then, Johnson has become one of Hollywood's highest-paid and most sought-after stars, starring in films like Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (2017), Moana (2016), and Rampage (2018). He has also founded a production company, Seven Bucks Productions, which has produced several films and TV shows.

Throughout his career, Johnson has received numerous awards and accolades, including a People's Choice Award, a Teen Choice Award, and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. He is known for his humility, dedication to his fans, and commitment to his Samoan heritage. With a net worth estimated over $300 million, Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson is undoubtedly one of the most successful and beloved entertainers in the world.

Throughout his career, Johnson has received numerous accolades, including a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, a Teen Choice Award, and multiple People's Choice Awards. He is also known for his philanthropic efforts, particularly in his native Hawaii, where he has supported various charitable initiatives.

Dwayne Douglas Johnson, popularly known as The Rock, is an American actor, producer, businessman, and former professional wrestler. He was born on May 2, 1972, in Hayward, California, to Ata Johnson and Rocky Johnson, both of whom had a background in professional wrestling.

Growing up, Johnson was a skilled athlete and played football at the University of Miami, where he won a national championship in 1991. After his college days, he pursued a career in professional wrestling, following in his father's footsteps. He joined the World Wrestling Federation (WWF), now known as WWE, in 1996 and quickly became a fan favorite, known for his charisma, athleticism, and electrifying performances.

Johnson's success in the WWE led to numerous championships, including six-time WWF/E Champion, two-time WWF Intercontinental Champion, and WWF Tag Team Champion. He also starred in several WWF storylines, including his iconic rivalry with Stone Cold Steve Austin.

In 2001, Johnson retired from professional wrestling to pursue an acting career. He made his film debut in "The Scorpion King" (2002), a prequel to "The Mummy Returns." His subsequent roles in films like "The Rundown" (2003), "Walking Tall" (2004), and "Be Cool" (2005) solidified his status as a Hollywood actor.

Johnson's breakthrough performance came in the 2007 film "The Game Plan," which led to a string of successful films, including "Get Smart" (2008), "Fast & Furious 6" (2013), "G.I. Joe: Retaliation" (2013), and "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" (2017). He has since become one of the highest-paid and most bankable stars in Hollywood.

In addition to his acting and wrestling career, Johnson is also a successful businessman, having founded his own production company, Seven Bucks Productions, and co-founding Project Rock, a line of athletic wear and accessories. He has also been named one of Time Magazine's 100 most influential people in the world.

Throughout his career, Johnson has received numerous accolades, including a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor, and a People's Choice Award for Favorite Premium Cable TV Actor
